text:
I'm Drew Keller, director
of BiGS at Harvard Business
School.

We're here in SÃ£o Paulo for our
first international executive
roundtable.

Today, we just
finished convening

75 of some of the most
influential and powerful

and inspirational business
leaders and nonprofit leaders

in the Latin American region
to have a robust conversation

about business's role in
addressing economic inequality
in Latin America.

One of the things
that excites me

the most about what we did today
but also about BiGS and Harvard

Business School's role in
changing the way that business

is done is the way
that Harvard can really

convene groups of people
who are change makers who

are passionate
about these topics

to have these conversations
about how business needs

to change to create
better outcomes for people
and the planet.

We had phenomenal discussions
around the best ways

that businesses
can create products

for underserved communities,
can create opportunities

for their employees,
and can just

generally improve economic
mobility across the Latin
American region.

Over the coming
weeks and months,

we'll be sharing what
we've learned here
in new and exciting ways.

We're going to
bring you everything

from videos to exclusive
interviews with CEOs

who are here today, to
reports, to articles.
So stay tuned.

This was our first
roundtable in Latin America,

and I'm excited to
see what comes next.

This is really
just the beginning

for Harvard Business
School and BiGS's journey

to create new strategies
for business leaders

to have better
outcomes for society.

And I'm excited to
see what comes next
and to drive more impact.
